value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SUMMARIZE in DAX/ Powerpivot.  The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. value.title: DAX Fridays! #7: ALL, ALLEXCEPT
value.excerpt: The function ALL returns all the rows in a table, or all the values in a column, ignoring any filters that might have been applied. value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.
